page.title: 01Sth Benfleet and Thundersley
page.content: This block covers two ancient settlements: South Benfleet and Thundersley. Both belong since 1974 to the large District Council of Castle Point, a name which was coined when the Canvey Island District merged with the Benfleet Urban District, which had only existed since 1929 when it was formed from the parishes of Hadleigh, South Benfleet and Thundersley. For 45 years the name Benfleet referred to all three parishes and its use is still confusing. It does not exist any longer and{South Benfleet}once again refers to the original settlement and its development covering the southern part of this block. It lies on a Creek of the river Thames about 35 miles (56Km) east of London. Thundersley is situated on a plateau covering the northern part of the block.
